attributes.action: Dismiss from office the minister or secretary of state who authorised the "removal" of a terminally ill woman from the United Kingdom
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ama Sumani was taken from a hospital and "removed from the country" (not deported despite all appearances) because she has overstayed her visa. The fact that she is terminally ill and will not be able to afford even palliative treatment in the country to which she has been "removed" means that she has effectively been condemned to a painful death. 

Do we, the people of the United Kingdom, really want our government to carry out this kind of action on our behalf and in our name? Surely there is room for compassion for the dying or did those who administer the law on our behalf see a 'soft' target to boost their figures?

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
